cyclone.name: MATTHEW
cyclone.current_location: about 125 mi SE of Cape Canaveral, Florida
cyclone.trajectory: Moving northwest along the east coast of Florida, then curving north-northwest toward the Georgia and South Carolina coasts
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: coastal Georgia near the Brunswick–St. Simons Island area

weather_observation.watch_coast: Tropical Storm Watch from Englewood to Anclote River, FL (does not include GA coast)
weather_observation.warning_coast: Hurricane Warning from Boca Raton, FL to South Santee River, SC (includes entire Georgia coast)
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Florida east coast, Georgia coast, and South Carolina coast
weather_observation.wind: High likelihood (≥70%) of sustained tropical-storm to hurricane-force winds with gusts well above 74 mph Friday night into Saturday.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Storm surge 7–11 ft above ground possible along the Georgia coast, including Brunswick and the lower Satilla and Altamaha Rivers.
weather_observation.rainfall: 6–12 inches of rain with isolated totals near 15 inches possible along the immediate coast.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Dangerous surf and rip currents, minor coastal flooding in advance of the surge, and a low risk of isolated tornadoes.
